at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.logging

Class ClientLoggingConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.logging.ClientLoggingConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServerLoggingConfiguration

    public class ClientLoggingConfiguration
extends Object
implements Serializable, Cloneable
    Defines the configuration of the client-side logging infrastructure.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • setCustomLoggingLevel

        public void setCustomLoggingLevel(String logger,
                         Level level)
        Sets the custom logging level for a specified logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - The name of the logger that should have custom configuration
        level - The custom level assigned to this logger

      • removeCustomLoggingLevel

        public void removeCustomLoggingLevel(String logger)
        Removes custom logging level for the specified logger.
        Parameters:
        logger - The name of the logger that should not use custom configuration any more.

      • setDefaultLoggingLevel

        public void setDefaultLoggingLevel(Level defaultLoggingLevel)
        Sets the default logging level for all loggers that have no custom level explicitly set.
        Parameters:
        defaultLoggingLevel - The level that should be used by default.

      • setParentLoggerName

        public void setParentLoggerName(String parentLoggerName)
        Sets the name of the parent logger for all loggers created from this configuration.
        Parameters:
        parentLoggerName -

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(Class<? extends Handler> handlerClass)
        Adds logger output handler that will handle output of all loggers created.
        Parameters:
        handlerClass - The class that implements Handler and has to handle output of the loggers.

      • getHandlers

        protected List<Handler> getHandlers()
        Gets all handlers currently configured to handle logging output.

      • setFormatter

        public void setFormatter(Class<? extends Formatter> formatterClass)
        Sets logging output formatter providing class.
        Parameters:
        formatterClass - The class that has to format logging messages.

      • getFormatter

        protected Formatter getFormatter()
        Gets currently configured formatter.
        Returns:
        Returns the instance of the formatter class.

      • getLogMessageTimeout

        public long getLogMessageTimeout()
        Determines the deadline after which messages will be just dropped.

      • setLogMessageTimeout

        public void setLogMessageTimeout(long logMessageTimeout)
        Determines the deadline after which messages will be just dropped.
        Parameters:
        logMessageTimeout - The timeout in milliseconds that specifies the delay when messages should be dropped instead of printing to the output.
